verses.verse: For I said in my haste, “I am cut off from before Your eyes”; Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications When I cried out to You.
Oh, love the LORD, all you His saints! For the LORD preserves the faithful, And fully repays the proud person.
((Ps. 27:14)) Be of good courage, And He shall strengthen your heart, All you who hope in the LORD.
(The Joy of Forgiveness) A Psalm of David. A Contemplation. ([1]) Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, Whose sin is covered.
Blessed is the man to whom the LORD ((2 Cor. 5:19)) does not impute iniquity, And (John 1:47) in whose spirit there is no deceit.
When I kept silent, my bones grew old Through my groaning all the day long.
For day and night Your (1 Sam. 5:6; Ps. 38:2; 39:10) hand was heavy upon me; My vitality was turned into the drought of summer. Selah

I acknowledged my sin to You, And my iniquity I have not hidden. (2 Sam. 12:13; Ps. 38:18; (Prov. 28:13; 1 John 1:9)) I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” And You forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah
((1 Tim. 1:16)) For this cause everyone who is godly shall (Ps. 69:13; Is. 55:6) pray to You In a time when You may be found; Surely in a flood of great waters They shall not come near him.
(Ps. 9:9) You are my hiding place; You shall preserve me from trouble; You shall surround me with (Ex. 15:1; Judg. 5:1; (Ps. 40:3)) songs of deliverance. Selah
I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will guide you with My eye.
Do not be like the (Prov. 26:3) horse or like the mule, Which have no understanding, Which must be harnessed with bit and bridle, Else they will not come near you.
(Ps. 16:4; (Prov. 13:21; Rom. 2:9)) Many sorrows shall be to the wicked; But ((Ps. 5:11, 12); Prov. 16:20) he who trusts in the LORD, mercy shall surround him.
(Ps. 64:10; 68:3; 97:12) Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you righteous; And shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
(The Sovereignty of the LORD in Creation and History) Rejoice (Ps. 32:11; 97:12; Phil. 3:1; 4:4) in the LORD, O you righteous! For praise from the upright is beautiful.
Praise the LORD with the harp; Make melody to Him with an instrument of ten strings.
Sing to Him a new song; Play skillfully with a shout of joy.
For the word of the LORD is right, And all His work is done in truth.
He loves righteousness and justice; The earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.
(Gen. 1:6, 7; Ps. 148:5; (Heb. 11:3; 2 Pet. 3:5)) By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, And all the (Gen. 2:1) host of them ((Job 26:13)) by the breath of His mouth.
(Gen. 1:9; Job 26:10; 38:8) He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; He lays up the deep in storehouses.
Let all the earth fear the LORD; Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
